header.headline: There are secrets left in the world.

index.summary: I'm a designer with a background in tech and startup companies. I've led design on several projects, and believe that it is my most direct way of impacting the world. I like to learn broadly, make things, and create exceptional experiences.

education.title: University of California at Berkeley
education.description: College of Environmental Design, Zero Energy Building, Berkeley Art Studio

education.title: Additional Education
education.description: 6 MOOCs completed from Stanford University, Johns Hopkins University, University of Toronto, University of Virginia / member of Lynda, recipient of two-year Treehouse Gold scholarship / workshops at AIGA, Tekserve, Noble Desktop, etc.

education.title: University of Florida
education.institution: Digital Arts & Sciences, College of Engineering
education.description: 1st place at IDEO JumpstART V / volunteer organizer for TEDxUF / finalist for The HackerHouse startup incubator / volunteer at 3DayStartup and Startup Weekend Gainesville / member of TEC, Software Development Club, Gators for Green Design, The Wildlife Society, and TED Club

education.title: Project Breaker
education.description: Worked with TED fellow Juliette LaMontagne Ed.D. on 3-month long project focused on improving civic engagement with technology in NYC through research, prototyping, and iteration, mentored by designers at Qlabs, Google Creative Lab, IDEO, frog design, worked out of AOL Ventures office in NYC

education.title: Northwestern University CTD
education.description: Learned engineering design principles, conducted a field study, earned an A

education.title: Neuqua Valley High School
education.description: ACT composite of 35 (above 99%-ile), AP Scholar w/ Distinction, National Merit, State Finalist in BPA, Illinois Innovation Talent, ΔΕΦ German Honor Society

work.title: Consultant
work.description: Working with Asia-Pacific team to improve experience and increase metrics

work.title: Co-founder & Design Lead
work.description: Led a team of 7, using design to make the legal experience better

work.title: Mobile Interface Design Intern
work.description: Led UX and UI for a full redesign of Hejia's mobile ERP client, working with iOS and Android developers to implement  on both platforms

work.title: Co-Founder, Designer
work.description: Conducted user interviews, data collection, created prototypes and interface for web app, won a $2000 grant from IMSA after presentation at MIT Enterprise Forum

work.title: Co-Founder, Designer
work.description: Assisted with market research, user interviews, product roadmap, and helped with launch at SPARK Chicago

work.title: Pilot Tester
work.description: Received Cr-48 prototype laptop from Chrome OS team and helped with testing and submitting bug reports

work.title: Intern
work.description: The summer before my senior year of high school, I helped a local marketing firm develop an incubator branch to trade equity for marketing services

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: Partnered with ComEd under Illinois Innovation Talent, audited facilities energy usage and designed plan to reduce computer idle time at my high school with IT department implementation, reducing electricity cost by $4,100 a year

volunteer.title: Lab Coordinator
volunteer.description: As Lab Coordinator, I served as liaison between CIW and labs, helping host labs with Accenture ACIN Lab, DraftFCB's Digital/UX, Northwestern University Knight Lab, and Navy Pier

volunteer.title: Bike Instructor
volunteer.description: While living in New York City for Project Breaker, I helped adults learn to bike (using an awesome method pioneered by Bike NY)

volunteer.title: Teaching Assistant
volunteer.description: I worked in the classroom and helped students practice & learn the Chinese language

awards: 1st place, IDEO JumpstART V with Duane Bray
